TextBlock.Text: Should we excavate <color=orange>Tidal Grove</color>? We stand to gain an understanding of how it stores and releases water, but the environmental impact is of major concern.
OENO: The fish would not like us disturbing their home. This is an absurd question.

CLARY: The fish tend to stay near the <color=orange>North Pole</color>. If we dug at the <color=orange>South Pole</color>, it would likely not impact them at all. We already use the <color=orange>South Pole</color> as a staging area for visitors.
OENO: It would certainly impact them if we inadvertently destroyed or damaged whatever produces their water supply while excavating!
CLARY: I concede, this is a terrible idea. Perhaps some things are better left untouched.
FILIX: Displacing the stone would likely lower the water's height, altering the environment. The issue most obvious to me is that excavating a hole wide enough for a Nomai is not a great solution.
CONOY: Wouldn't our time be better suited towards furthering our search for the <color=orange>Eye of the Universe</color>?
